details.description: Get approval before you start any building work - your builder will usually do this for you but as the owner of a building you may be held responsible
details.body:
You must check if you need building regulations approval before you start any building work - your builder will usually do this for you but as the owner of a building you may be held responsible.

You usually need building regulations approval if you:

  • put up a new building
  • extend or alter an existing building
  • install services or fittings in a building, eg washing and sanitary facilities, hot water cylinders, foul water and rainwater drainage, replacement windows and any fuel burning appliances

Building regulations approval is separate from planning permission - you may need to get both.

Apply for building regulations approval through your local council or a private approved inspector.

Sometimes your installer (eg of windows or boilers) can self-certify the work if they’re registered with a competent person scheme. This means you don’t need to apply for approval yourself. Check with your installer and read the booklet below to find out what type of work can be self-certified.

Download ‘Building work, repairs and replacements to your home’ (PDF, 160KB)

You must follow the safety and energy efficiency rules set out in the building regulations even if you don’t need to get formal approval.
